intro: Mosla japonica var. robusta, commonly known as Japanese mosquito plant or robust mosla, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It features aromatic, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink to purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or borders. Its compact growth habit and ornamental value make it a popular addition to gardens and herbal collections.
